FuncDef:
The whitelist session-car rsvp-te command sets Session-CAR parameters for the RSVP-TE whitelist.
The undo whitelist session-car rsvp-te command restores the default Session-CAR values for the RSVP-TE whitelist.
By default, the CIR, CBS, PIR, and PBS of the Session-CAR function for the RSVP-TE whitelist are 75 kbit/s, 15000 bytes, 4000 kbit/s, and 9000000 bytes, respectively.
CLIs: whitelist session-car rsvp-te { cir <cir-value> | cbs <cbs-value> | pir <pir-value> | pbs <pbs-value> } *
undo whitelist session-car rsvp-te [ { cir <cir-value> | cbs <cbs-value> | pir <pir-value> | pbs <pbs-value> } * ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a committed information rate (CIR), that is, the average rate at which packets can be transmitted or forwarded.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1000000, in kbit/s. The default value is 75.

Specifies a committed burst size (CBS), that is, the committed volume of burst traffic that can pass instantly.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 9000000, in bytes. The default value is 15000.

Specifies a peak information rate (PIR), that is, the peak rate at which packets can be transmitted or forwarded.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1000000, in kbit/s. The default value is 4000.

Specifies a peak burst size (PBS), that is, the peak volume of burst traffic that can pass instantly.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 9000000, in bytes. The default value is 9000000.

Examples: [~HUAWEI] whitelist session-car rsvp-te cir 2 cbs 1600 pir 4000 pbs 5000
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If a device receives a large number of RSVP-TE messages, you can run the whitelist session-car rsvp-te command to modify the bandwidth values as needed for the message channels between RSVP-TE sessions. This configuration ensures that RSVP-TE messages can be properly sent.
Precautions
pir-value must be greater than or equal to cir-value. If you attempt to set a pir-value value smaller than cir-value, the following error message will be displayed: "Error: The pir %d must be greater than or equal to the cir %d."
pbs-value must be greater than or equal to cbs-value. If you attempt to set a pbs-value value smaller than cbs-value, the following error message will be displayed: "Error: The pbs %d must be greater than or equal to the cbs %d."
